Definition: You will receive an utterance and recent dialogue context containing past 3 utterances. Output 'Yes' if the utterance contains the vouch-fair strategy, otherwise output 'No'. Vouch-fair is a selfish negotiation strategy used to call out fairness for personal benefit. This can be done through an explicit call out or can be implied.

Positive Examples.input:
Context: 'Yeah, I'm going to the desert so I'm hoping to have enough water. I'm good on food and I hunt for a lot of it anyways.' 'I've never been a good hunter. I wish I had those abilities.' 'I would part with all the food if I could get all the firewood.'
Utterance: 'That seems fair. How about water. How would that be split? I'm very concerned.'
Positive Examples.explanation: This is correct since the participant points out that the proposed deal seems fair.

Positive Examples.input:
Context: 'I really need that extra food for me and my bother. we have one to spare' 'so what is the whole deal here? ' 'you get 3 firewood I get 3 waters and now food I will give you 1 if that is ok🙂'
Utterance: 'and I have to give you more food or not?'
Positive Examples.explanation: Correct. The participant does not call out the fairness of the deal in any way.

Negative Examples.input:
Context: 'Heck yes! I am excited. How about you?' 'I can't wait 🙂 Let's talk about these supplies. I've got hungry mouths to feed, Can I take the food and you can have half the firewood and all the water?' 'Hmm, I need food too. I am willing to split. I will give you 2 food since you claimed it first. Can I have 2 waters then?'
Utterance: 'That's fair, but I have wiggle room on the water, how about I take two food, two firewood and you take 3 water, 1 food, 1 firewood?'
Negative Examples.explanation: The participant explicitly points out that the proposal by the opponent is fair so this is wrong. The correct answer would be 'Yes'.

Negative Examples.input:
Context: 'You can take two firewood an i can get one. I really don't need much. of that. are you okay with that?' 'I am okay with that 🙂' 'okay an for as the water two for me an 2 for you right? are you sure?'
Utterance: 'Yes, as long as I can get two of the food. '
Negative Examples.explanation: This is wrong since the utterance does not refer to the evaluation of the deal. The correct answer is No.

Instances.input:
Context: 'Well you can take all the firewood if it will help, would it be ok if i get all the food in return?' 'That works for me. How would you like to divide the water?' 'I am ok with you taking two waters since you are new to camping, does that seem fair to you?'
Utterance: 'Yes, that seems fair to me.'

Context: 'Hi, I would like all of the water and 2 food packages. You can have all of the firewood and one food package. Does that sound good?'
Utterance: 'Nice to meet you! I definitely like the idea of having all of the firewood, but water is very important to me. Let's see if we can come to and agreement on how to split up the water.'

Context: 'Ok - you're not being reasonable at all.  If you're so incompetent at going camping, maybe you should stay home and I can take all the supplies. How's that for an excellent offer?  All for me and 0 for you.' 'I think it would be good to come to a compromise. If I take all of the water and have the 2 foods, you can take all of the firewood as you originally proposed. Yet, I will have a tough time learning how to survive on a camping trip.😡' 'Again, that's not a fair compromise....You get all of what we both we want and more of another item.  Let me state it to you clearly so you can understand.  I WILL NOT ACCEPT THAT OFFER.  There is no chance you are getting all the water now that I think about it.  I will offer I get 1 water, 2 firewood, and 2 food.  If you can't come up with a reasonable offer, I will just walk away and we both get nothing.  I will survive because I will have skills.'
Utterance: 'I think this is reasonable because you have a big family. I will accept 2 waters, 1 firewood, and 1 food. '

Context: 'I see, well it sounds like you're going to need some additional food with those children. How about I provide you with some additional food and you can help me with my need for heat with firewood?' 'okay how i take all 3 food and 1 firewood?' 'The firewood sounds like a solid deal; I would need a little food though to assist me. The good news is since there's a stream near me, I won't need any additional water, so I am happy to provide you with all of the additional water.'
Utterance: 'i am not able to do that unfortunately i desperately need firewood. '

Context: 'Water is important!! To me firewood is more important as I have anemia and I'm ALWAYS cold lol' 'Alright. I have a  feeling we will have a deal then. How about you give me two water for a firewood?' 'that sounds like a plan'
Utterance: 'how many firewood you need? Maybe we could also exchange one food for one more firewood?'

Context: 'so if i were to  give you water what would i get ?' 'You'd be getting 1 water, 2 firewood, and 1 food' 'how much food are you willing to offer for water'
Utterance: 'We can go back to my original offer which was honestly more generous.. I get 2 Water, 1 Firewood, 1 food.. you get 1 water, 2 firewood, 2 food.. its honestly a better deal for you 🙂'

Context: 'so I'll get 2 water, 3 food and 0 firewood?' 'Incorrect. ' 'In order to make it work I need at least 3 water and 2 food. Or I could do 3 firewood and 2 food and 0 water. I don't see any other way around it'
Utterance: 'It has to be fair. Right now I don't think you are being fair. The last offer I gave was great for you. You all all of the food and 2 water.You wanted 3 food in your last offer so thats a great offer I suggested.'

Context: 'Thank you.  WOuld you be willing to give me all the food?  I would give you all the water and 2 firewood.' 'I can give you all the food and 1 water. I get all firewood and 2 water.' 'I need at least one firewood to cook my food.  Can you give me one firewood for all the water?'
Utterance: 'I'm sorry. I won't be able to do that.'
